result.execSummary:
The defendant Michaela R. Hammett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May terminate probation after two (2) years if conditions successfully completed.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to have no contact with the victim or her residence.  The Defendant is subject to random drug/UA testing.  Defendant is to successfully participate in her intensive outpatient at Theda Care.  Defendant is to provide a letter of apology for the victim within 30 days to the probation agent.

timeConds.notes: Conditional jail time.  Seven (7) months stayed.  30 days to be served with Huber privileges for treatment and child care.  Not eligible for good time.  To begin sentence on or by 10/10/22.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
